page.title: 16Oystermouth - Inshore Rescue
page.content:
To deal with incidents which do not need the service of the big Lifeboat, there is a smaller Inshore Rescue Boat.
The first Inshore Rescue Boat was used in 1963. It has a crew of 2 or 3 who are also members of the Lifeboat crew. This D Class inflatable boat has a speed of 20 knots and can carry between 10 and 12 people. Already this year it has been called out 11 times.
The Lifeboat Secretary decides which of the two boats is needed to answer an emergency call. One who answers the call is Arthur Eynon, whose son James is in J1.
